greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest prime dividing n which is less than A020639(n)^2, where A020639(n) is the smallest prime dividing n, a(1) = 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
mathematica: Table[Last[Function[s, Select[s, # < First[s]^2 &]]@ FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]] /. {} -> {1}], {n, 109}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 24 2017 *)
program: (PARI) A(n) = if(n<2, return(1), my(f=factor(n)[, 1]); for(i=2, #f, if(f[i]>f[1]^2, return(f[i]))); return(1));
for(n=1, 150, print1(gpf(n/a(n)),", ")) \\ _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 24 2017, after _David A. Corneth_
def a(n): return 1 if A(n)==1 else A(n)*a(n//A(n))
def gpf(n): return 1 if n<2 else max(primefactors(n))
print([gpf(n//a(n)) for n in range(1, 151)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 24 2017
xref: Cf. A251726 (gives n > 1 such that a(n) = A006530(n)).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 24 2017
